subject: RE: [junit] Re: Junit report xsl stylesheet
msgSnippet: ... Hi, Sounds like something a manager I used to have would love.  But what s the real value of it? ... Sounds like you are selling Viagra or something.  Very
messageBody:
> From: Robert Hostlowsky [mailto:skylab@...]
>
> Hello (again),
>
> how about an extended XSL transformation, which marks your
> unit tests with differnt colors ?
> (see http://junitour.sourceforge.net/junit-noframes.html)

Hi,

Sounds like something a manager I used to have would love. But what's the real value of it?

> There are also some new, very interesting features
> to get more information from the junit reports!
> Checkit out !
> Just look at the sample at:
> http://junitour.sf.net

Sounds like you are selling Viagra or something. Very enthusiastic, though, I gotta admit. What do you think are the very interesting features?

I checked out the Web site yesterday. I think that creating new Exceptions that implement a "UnitTestIncomplete" interface, throwing those exceptions to indicate incomplete test* methods, and then using a custom style sheet to flag those results or filter them out is a very inefficient, over-engineered and non-scalable way to do things.

Best,
Scott Stirling
Workscape, Inc.
